definition: lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]

sentences.english: With advent of technology, this is not needed now.
sentences.chinese: 与科技发展一日千里，这是没有必要的。

sentences.english: The industry continues to grow at a tremendous pace internationally.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业继续增长一日千里的国际竞争力。

sentences.english: Higher education has developed very rapidly in the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 过去十年，本港高等教育的发展一日千里。

sentences.english: The studies on human dental stem cells have been greatly progressed during recent five years.
sentences.chinese: 近五年来，牙齿干细胞新知一日千里。

definition: to advance by leaps and bounds
every day sees new developments (idiom)/to make constant progress
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
lightning speed/amazingly rapid/incredible pace of development
to make a breakthrough
things are very different now (idiom)/times have changed
remarkable (progress, improvement, expansion etc)
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
to succeed/successful
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
income/(literary) improvement/progress
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
